content.raw:
Jenkins builds a couple of jobs which disable BDIinterface and logging:

1. [No atlas interface](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/drcsim-drcsim_2.6-gazebo-gazebo_1.8-noatlasinterface-precise-amd64-gpu-sl-tesla/). displayed a segfault yesterday. 
 *vrc_task_1_gzlog_stop_longrun.test*

2. One of the [no logging jobs](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/drcsim-nightly-nologging-precise-amd64/), displayed a [segfault](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/drcsim-nightly-nologging-precise-amd64/2/parsed_console/job/drcsim-nightly-nologging-precise-amd64/2/parsed_console/log_content.html#ERROR1) today:
  *atlas_sandia_hands_publishers_hz_gpu.test*
content.html:
Jenkins builds a couple of jobs which disable BDIinterface and logging:

  1. No atlas interface. displayed a segfault yesterday. vrc_task_1_gzlog_stop_longrun.test

  2. One of the no logging jobs, displayed a segfault today: atlas_sandia_hands_publishers_hz_gpu.test

content.raw: I would say that most are happening in gzlog and rosapi. Let's wait until pull request #517 jenkins jobs finished to look for more information.
content.html: I would say that most are happening in gzlog and rosapi. Let's wait until pull request #517 jenkins jobs finished to look for more information.

content.raw:
I've gone back through some of our Jenkins build history. The earliest segmentation fault I can find in a drcsim-2.6_gazebo-1.8 branch is from [May 24th](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/drcsim-drcsim_2.6-gazebo-gazebo_1.8-devel-precise-amd64-gpu-amazon-vrc/7/).

I also looked at the drcsim-default-gazebo-default builds back to May 16th and didn't see any seg-faults, and the first seg-fault I see is on [May 23rd](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/drcsim/job/drcsim-default-gazebo-default-devel-precise-amd64/220/) when we merged gazebo_1.8 back to default in pull request #540.

That included pull request #529, pull request #531, pull request #533, pull request #530, pull request #535, and pull request #537.
content.html:
I've gone back through some of our Jenkins build history. The earliest segmentation fault I can find in a drcsim-2.6_gazebo-1.8 branch is from May 24th.

I also looked at the drcsim-default-gazebo-default builds back to May 16th and didn't see any seg-faults, and the first seg-fault I see is on May 23rd when we merged gazebo_1.8 back to default in pull request #540.

That included pull request #529, pull request #531, pull request #533, pull request #530, pull request #535, and pull request #537.

content.raw: Interesting.  I guess that `this->states` is corrupt at that point, perhaps from an earlier concurrent write?  Out of curiosity, why use `[0]` to pull the first element out of a `deque`, instead of `front()`?
content.html: Interesting. I guess that this->states is corrupt at that point, perhaps from an earlier concurrent write? Out of curiosity, why use [0] to pull the first element out of a deque, instead of front()?
